questions.text: How many members serve on the Bloomington Common Council?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the Bloomington Common Council is composed of nine (9) members elected from three council districts.

questions.text: Who is Bloomington's current mayor as of 2024?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Kerry Thomson became Bloomington's 33rd Mayor on January 1, 2024. Her term runs through December 31, 2027.

questions.text: How many council districts is Bloomington divided into for Common Council elections?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the City of Bloomington is divided into three council districts, with three council members elected from each district.

questions.text: What form of government does Bloomington operate under?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington operates under a mayor-council form of government, where the Mayor serves as chief executive and the Common Council serves as the legislative branch.

questions.text: How long is the term for Bloomington City Council members?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, council members serve 4-year terms, with elections held in odd-numbered years during municipal elections.

questions.text: In what year was Bloomington incorporated as a city?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington was incorporated as a town in 1818 and as a city in 1876.

questions.text: How many parks does Bloomington Parks and Recreation manage?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington Parks and Recreation manages 32 parks throughout the city.

questions.text: Which city department is responsible for reviewing zoning permits and development projects?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the Planning and Transportation Department reviews development petitions, administers and issues permits, and enforces zoning ordinances.

questions.text: What special benefit does the City of Bloomington Animal Shelter offer to fire victims?
options: Waived adoption fee for one animal
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, if you lose your pet in a fire, the City of Bloomington Animal Shelter will waive the adoption fee for one animal.

questions.text: How many pools does Bloomington Parks and Recreation operate?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington Parks and Recreation operates 2 pools in the city.

questions.text: What is the primary responsibility of the Bloomington Common Council?
options: Adopting the city budget and passing ordinances
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the Bloomington Common Council serves as the legislative body and is responsible for adopting the city budget, setting property tax rates, passing city ordinances, and approving zoning changes.

questions.text: Before becoming mayor, Kerry Thomson served as Executive Director of which Indiana University center?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Kerry Thomson became the Executive Director of Indiana University's Center for Rural Engagement in 2018, where she expanded its reach into 50 counties.

questions.text: What is the approximate population of Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington is home to 85,000 residents and serves as a home away from home for tens of thousands of Indiana University students.

questions.text: How many members serve on the Monroe County Board of Commissioners?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the Monroe County Board of Commissioners consists of three members elected from three districts who serve as the chief executive body for the county.

questions.text: What is the county seat of Monroe County?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, Bloomington is the county seat of Monroe County, Indiana. The county was formed in 1818 and named after President James Monroe.

questions.text: How many members serve on the Monroe County Council?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the Monroe County Council consists of seven members — four elected from districts and three elected at-large — who control county finances and adopt the budget.

questions.text: In what year was Monroe County established?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, Monroe County was established by the Indiana General Assembly on November 14, 1818, and was named for President James Monroe.

questions.text: Which Monroe County elected official is responsible for maintaining land records and deeds?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the County Recorder maintains land records and deeds, while the County Clerk maintains court records and administers elections.

questions.text: What is the approximate population of Monroe County?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, Monroe County has a population of approximately 148,000 residents, with Bloomington being the largest city and home to Indiana University.

questions.text: Which Monroe County elected official is responsible for prosecuting criminal cases?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the County Prosecutor is an elected official responsible for prosecuting criminal cases in Monroe County.

questions.text: Which Monroe County elected official determines property values for tax purposes?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the County Assessor is an elected official responsible for determining property values for tax purposes in Monroe County.

questions.text: What is the primary responsibility of the Monroe County Council?
options: Controlling county finances and adopting the budget
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the Monroe County Council is the fiscal body of county government responsible for adopting the county budget, setting tax rates, and approving expenditures.

questions.text: Which Monroe County elected official is responsible for law enforcement and jail management?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the County Sheriff is an elected official responsible for law enforcement and jail management in Monroe County.

questions.text: Which Monroe County elected official administers elections and maintains court records?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the County Clerk is an elected official responsible for maintaining court records and administering elections in Monroe County.

questions.text: Which Monroe County elected official collects taxes and manages county funds?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, the County Treasurer is an elected official responsible for collecting taxes and managing county funds in Monroe County.

questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the City of Bloomington is divided into three council districts, with three council members elected from each district.

questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, Monroe County was formed in 1818 and named after President James Monroe.

questions.text: When did Indiana become a state?
questions.explanation: According to in.gov, Indiana achieved statehood on December 11, 1816, becoming the 19th state.

questions.text: What is Indiana's official state nickname?
questions.explanation: According to in.gov, Indiana's state nickname is the "Hoosier State," a term used since the early 19th century.

questions.text: How many members serve in the Indiana House of Representatives?
questions.explanation: According to iga.in.gov, the Indiana House of Representatives has 100 representatives who serve 2-year terms.

questions.text: How many senators serve in the Indiana Senate?
questions.explanation: According to iga.in.gov, the Indiana Senate has 50 senators who serve 4-year terms.

questions.text: When was the current Indiana Constitution adopted?
questions.explanation: According to in.gov, the current Indiana Constitution was adopted in 1851.

questions.text: What time do polls open on Election Day in Indiana?
questions.explanation: According to in.gov/sos/elections, polls in Indiana are open from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM local time on Election Day.

questions.text: When was Bloomington established as the county seat of Monroe County?
questions.explanation: According to co.monroe.in.us, Bloomington was established as the county seat in 1818, the same year Monroe County was formed.

questions.text: In what year are Bloomington city elections held?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington city elections occur in odd-numbered years, with elections held for Mayor, City Council, and City Clerk.

questions.text: How many parks does Bloomington Parks and Recreation manage?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/parks, Bloomington Parks and Recreation manages 32 parks throughout the city.

questions.text: What is Indiana's state motto?
questions.explanation: According to in.gov, Indiana's state motto is "Crossroads of America," which appears on the state seal and state highway signs.

questions.text: When was the Indiana Statehouse completed?
questions.explanation: According to iga.in.gov, the Indiana Statehouse, located in Indianapolis and home to the Indiana General Assembly, was completed in 1888.

questions.text: What is the voter registration deadline in Indiana before an election?
questions.explanation: According to in.gov/sos/elections, the voter registration deadline in Indiana is 29 days before an election.

questions.text: Which organization before becoming mayor did Kerry Thomson lead that expanded into 50 Indiana counties?
options: Habitat for Humanity of Monroe County
Indiana University's Center for Rural Engagement
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Kerry Thomson became Executive Director of Indiana University's Center for Rural Engagement in 2018, where she expanded its reach into 50 counties, impacting 20,000 Hoosiers through 300 different projects.

questions.text: What happens if you lose your pet in a fire in Bloomington?
options: The fire department provides temporary housing
The Animal Shelter waives the adoption fee for one animal
You receive a voucher for pet supplies
The city provides free veterinary care
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, if you lose your pet in a fire, the City of Bloomington Animal Shelter will waive the adoption fee for one animal.

questions.text: In what years are Bloomington municipal elections held?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington City Council elections are held in odd-numbered years (municipal elections).

questions.text: What is the phone number for the Bloomington Police Department's non-emergency line?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the Bloomington Police Department's phone number is 812-339-4477.

questions.text: Which body is responsible for adopting the city budget in Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the Bloomington Common Council adopts the city budget and sets property tax rates.

questions.text: What is the population of Bloomington according to city sources?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington is home to 85,000 residents.

questions.text: How many trails does Bloomington Parks and Recreation maintain?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington Parks and Recreation maintains 11 trails throughout the city.

questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Indiana University was established in Bloomington in 1820.

questions.text: What is Kerry Thomson's number as Mayor of Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Kerry Thomson became Bloomington's 33rd Mayor on January 1, 2024.

questions.text: Which department provides water and wastewater services in Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, City Utilities (also known as City of Bloomington Utilities or CBU) provides water and wastewater services to the city.

questions.text: What is the voter registration deadline in Indiana before an election?
questions.explanation: According to in.gov, the voter registration deadline in Indiana is 29 days before an election.

questions.text: What hours are polling places open on Election Day in Indiana?
questions.explanation: According to in.gov, polls in Indiana are open from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM local time on Election Day.

questions.text: Which elected official is responsible for maintaining city records and administering city elections in Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the Bloomington City Clerk is an elected position responsible for maintaining city records, administering city elections, and serving as clerk to the Common Council.

questions.text: How many sports complexes does Bloomington Parks and Recreation operate?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, Bloomington Parks and Recreation operates 4 sports complexes in the city.

questions.text: Who confirms mayoral appointments to boards and commissions in Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov, the Bloomington Common Council confirms mayoral appointments to boards and commissions.

questions.text: Does Indiana allow same-day voter registration?
options: Yes, but only during early voting
No, same-day registration is not available
Yes, but only for first-time voters
questions.explanation: According to in.gov, same-day registration is not available in Indiana. Voters must register at least 29 days before an election.

questions.text: What is the street address of the Mayor's Office in Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/mayor, the Mayor's Office is located at 401 North Morton Street, Suite 210, Bloomington, Indiana 47404.

questions.text: Which body reviews and approves city contracts in Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/city-council, the Bloomington Common Council reviews and approves contracts as part of its legislative responsibilities.

questions.text: How many holes does the Bloomington Parks and Recreation golf course have?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/parks, Bloomington Parks and Recreation operates a 27-hole golf club with a pro shop, locker rooms, and banquet facility.

questions.text: How many ice arenas does Bloomington Parks and Recreation operate?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/parks, the Parks and Recreation Department operates 1 ice arena, the Frank Southern Ice Arena.

questions.text: What is the street address of the Bloomington Police Department?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/police, the Bloomington Police Department is located at 220 E Third St, Bloomington, IN 47401.

questions.text: Which body passes city ordinances in Bloomington?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/city-council, the Bloomington Common Council passes city ordinances as part of its legislative responsibilities.

questions.text: What is the phone number for City of Bloomington Utilities?
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/utilities, City of Bloomington Utilities can be reached at 812-339-1444 for after-hours service, or 812-349-3930 for customer service during business hours.

questions.text: Before becoming Mayor, Kerry Thomson served as CEO of which local organization?
options: Habitat for Humanity of Monroe County
questions.explanation: According to bloomington.in.gov/mayor, Kerry Thomson was the former CEO of Habitat for Humanity of Monroe County, where she served for 20 years before becoming Executive Director of IU's Center for Rural Engagement.
